jtxt.emulator.tui

Interface Layout

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GridLayout, SequentialLayout

    public interface Layout
    Allocates the bounds of a Container's children, using objects passed to these children to determine the location in which they will be placed.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Region getBounds(java.lang.Object parameters)
      Calculates the size of the Region that a Component may be placed within, using the given parameters object to make this calculation.
      default void setComponentBounds(Component child)
      Sets the bounds of a Component, using the parameter object that the component has defined.
      void setParentBounds(Region parentBounds)
      Sets the bounds of the parent container that this Layout manages.

    • Method Detail

      • getBounds

        Region getBounds(java.lang.Object parameters)
        Calculates the size of the Region that a Component may be placed within, using the given parameters object to make this calculation. The type of this object, as well as the way that it affects the determination of the bounds, is implementation-dependent. This method may throw an error if the type of this parameter is incorrect (because a client passed an incorrect parameter when constructing a Component).
        Parameters:
        parameters - An object which describes the positioning information that will be used to calculate these bounds. This is implementation dependent, and the type of this object is likely to change between different Layouts.
        Returns:
        The bounds that the parameters object represents.

      • setParentBounds

        void setParentBounds(Region parentBounds)
        Sets the bounds of the parent container that this Layout manages.
        Parameters:
        parentBounds - The bounds of the Container that this Layout manages.

      • setComponentBounds

        default void setComponentBounds(Component child)
        Sets the bounds of a Component, using the parameter object that the component has defined.
        Parameters:
        child - The Component to allocate bounds to.
